newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Labroy Marine rises amid tanker rumours.
newsitem.headline: Labroy Marine rises amid tanker rumours.

text.p: Shares in newly-listed shipbuilding company Labroy Marine Ltd soared 16 percent, or 13 cents, to a high of Singapore $0.96 on Monday on rumours it may have contracts to build more product tankers.
"There is speculation on the size of its contracts for the supply of product tankers to Indonesia," said one dealer. "Most of the buying is from retail clients."
By 0800 GMT, Labroy shares stood at 93.5 cents, up 10.5 cents, on just over 28 million shares traded.
Of this total, only 2.2 million shares were crossed off the market in a variety of block deals at different prices.
Labroy builds commercial tugs, barges, general cargo vessels and marine steel structures and provides ship-repair and conversion services, mainly in its shipyard in Batam, Indonesia.
Officials at the company were unavailable for immediate comment.
